jeez man how did you not get the memo that it's at the start of the game. why would they ever implement a system where a team could remake 40mins in lol.

i was in a game where my team voted for a remake as it was an instant 4v5. it's basically like a surrender vote except you can only vote for it once a special message pops up. there's a time limit to vote. if the vote fails, then that's it. 

and no, it would be hard to abuse anyway, unless you had a lot of "dud accounts". if you kept intent doing it your accounts will get banned. besides it makes no sense. why would you intentionally increase your chance of not winning?? how is that advantageous in any way? sure maybe you would win the odd game or 2 but the vast majority of times you would be forced to remake and thus never climb.

BUZZ

Your wrong, Remake is working as intended, and a lot of people don't understand the simplest part.

If someone doesn't connect AT THE START OF THE GAME a remake is always available unless they come back.

If the DC is AFTER first blood then the game continues with no remake option.

So examples:

Game starts as a 4v5, getting a kill on the 4 doesn't stop the remake.

Game starts 5v5, First blood is drawn AND THEN someone disconnects this ISN'T A REMAKE

Game starts 5v5, someone DC's at like 30 seconds before a first blood is drawn and makes it 5v4, the 4 can still force a remake.

So you can keep playing right up until the enemy is about to win and then /remake, providing it stays 4v5? 

thats too troll, there needs to be a time limit, otherwise people will queue with a dud account, play for 30 mins, wait for the enemy to almost win /remake and just leave it to take the fall just to troll everyone's ranked games with no re-purcussions to themselves.

i have won many 4v5s so i know its not impossible, so in theory, if you duoed with a dud account let it afk and then try to win, if you did win then great, you get LP, and if you are about to lose you just /Remake and suffer no loss? so in theory you would NEVER lose a game.

that BS!

No to my knowledge the vote starts at 3 minutes (regardless of scenario).

>If any player is dcâ€™d or flagged afk for at least 90 seconds **at the three minute mark, a /remake is available**
